text: To bear with patience wrongs done to oneself is a mark of perfection, but to bear with patience wrongs done to someone else is a mark of imperfection and even of actual sin.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: A garden is a grand teacher. It teaches patience and careful watchfulness it teaches industry and thrift above all it teaches entire trust.
author: Gertrude Jekyll

text: Endurance is the crowning quality, And patience all the passion of great hearts.
author: James Russell Lowell

text: It takes patience to appreciate domestic bliss volatile spirits prefer unhappiness.
author: George Santayana

text: Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.
author: Hal Borland
